FuncDef: This command configures shortest path (SPT) tree switchover thresholds for group prefixes.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the group IPv4 multicast address in dotted decimal notation. Values-a.b.c.d.
Specifies the length of the IPv4 prefix. Values-4 to 32.
Specifies the netmask associated with the IPv4 prefix, expressed in dotted decimal notation. Network bits must be 1, and host bits must be 0. Values-a.b.c.d.
Specifies the group IPv6 multicast address in hexadecimal notation. Values-xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx (eight 16-bit pieces).
Specifies the length of the IPv6 prefix. Values-8 to 128.

Specifies the configured threshold in kilobits per second (kb/s) for a group prefix. A switchover is attempted only if the traffic rate on the shared tree for the group exceeds this configured threshold. When the infinity keyword is specified, no switchover will occur at any time, regardless of the traffic level is detected. Values-1 to 4294967294 | infinity.
